timezone.daily_rollover_rule: Use the local calendar date in America/New_York. The daily puzzle changes at midnight America/New_York.

board.blocked_tiles_behavior: Always black/inert. Player only enters letters in the last L tiles of each row.

scoring.repeat_letter_handling: Use answer letter-counts: assign greens first, then assign yellows only while remaining counts > 0.

basic_rules_guidance.answers_are_bible_themed: Possible answers are Bible-themed and include names, places, key concepts, and common words that appear in the Bible.
basic_rules_guidance.allowed_characters: Letters A–Z only (no hyphens, apostrophes, spaces, or diacritics).
basic_rules_guidance.note_on_s_ending_words: Some answers end in 'S' because they are plural/inflected forms (e.g., ANGELS, KINGS) and some are proper names/books (e.g., MOSES, JESUS, AMOS, ACTS). Do not assume answers are always singular.

ui_required_display.show_length_and_guess_count: Always show: '{L} letters • {G} guesses' for the current puzzle.

allowed_guesses.definition: Allowed guesses = answers + general English words (A–Z only) of length 4–6 from dwyl/english-words words_alpha.txt.

daily_selection.goal: Quasi-random daily puzzle with no repeats until the list is exhausted.
algorithm: Compute dayIndex = days_between(start_date_local and today's local date in America/New_York). Clamp to >= 0.
cycle = floor(dayIndex / N), i = dayIndex % N.
Create a deterministic permutation permCycle of [0..N-1] using Fisher–Yates with PRNG seeded by hash32(BASE_SEED + ':' + cycle).
This guarantees no repeats for N days, then reshuffles next cycle.
daily_selection.prng_reference: xmur3 (string->uint32) + mulberry32 (uint32->rng) or equivalent deterministic PRNG
